Public Member Functions
var::Ring Class Reference
Inheritance diagram for var::Ring:

Documentation

Ring is a ring buffer (or circular buffer) that uses a local memory buffer for the data.

Member Function Documentation

u32 var::Ring::calc_free ( ) const

Calculates the number of free bytes in the buffer.

u32 var::Ring::calc_used ( ) const

Calculates the number of bytes calc_used in the buffer.

void var::Ring::flush ( void  )

Flushes the buffer.

bool var::Ring::is_overflow_allowed ( ) const
inline

Accesses whether or not buffer allows overwriting The default value for overflow allowed is true. Use set_overflow_allowed(false) to disable overflow.

int var::Ring::read ( u8 *  buf,
u32  nbytes 
)

Reads data from the ring buffer.

Parameters
bufA pointer to the destination data buffer
nbytesThe number of bytes to read
Returns
void var::Ring::set_overflow_allowed ( bool  value = true)
inline

Sets whether or not overflow is allowed in the buffer.

If overflow is allowed, write() will always write and return nbytes as specified. If overflow is not allowed, write() will only write until the buffer is full.

Parameters
valueTrue to allow overflow or false to disallow it.
u32 var::Ring::size ( ) const
inline

Accesses the size of the buffer.

int var::Ring::write ( const u8 *  buf,
u32  nbytes 
)

Writes data to the ring buffer.

Parameters
bufPointer to the data to write
nbytesThe number of bytes to write
Returns
The number of bytes written
